thobe.widgets.multiFramePanel

Interface MultiFrameLayout

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractMultiFrameLayout, Layout_1Single, Layout_2SideBySide, Layout_2Stacked, Layout_3SideBySide, Layout_3StackedLeft, Layout_3StackedRight, Layout_4SideBySide, Layout_4Stacked

    public interface MultiFrameLayout
    Author:
    Thomas Obenaus

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void buildFrameTree(java.util.List<Frame> frames)
      This method builds up an internal hierarchical representation of the Frame's that should be layed out.
      void doLayout(BoundingBox boundingBox)
      Adjusts the sizes/ bounding-boxes of the Frame's that are registered.
      java.lang.String getDescription()
      Returns a description of the layout => may be used as tool-tip.
      FrameContainer getFrameContainerWithDividerUnderCursor(FrameTreeNode node, int x, int y)
      Returns the FrameContainer whose Divider is under the cursor (or the position specified by x and y).
      FrameTreeNode getFrameTreeRoot()
      Returns the root of the layout specific internal hierarchical representation of this MultiFrameLayout.
      int getID() 
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the name of the layout.
      int numberOfFramesLayedOut()
      Returns the number of Frame's that can be layed out using this MultiFrameLayout
      void onMouseDragged(int x, int y)
      Respond on mouse-dragged events.
      void onMouseExited() 
      void onMouseMoved(int x, int y)
      Respond on mouse-move events.
      void onMousePressed(int x, int y)
      Respond on mouse-pressed events.
      void onMouseReleased(int x, int y)
      Respond on mouse-released events.

      • doLayout

        Parameters:

      • getFrameContainerWithDividerUnderCursor

        FrameContainer getFrameContainerWithDividerUnderCursor(FrameTreeNode node,
                                                     int x,
                                                     int y)
        Returns the FrameContainer whose Divider is under the cursor (or the position specified by x and y).
        Parameters:
        node - - The FrameTreeNode where the lookup should start. This FrameTreeNode will be traversed until the according FrameContainer is found or until no more FrameTreeNode's are untouched.
        x -
        y -
        Returns:
        - The FrameContainer whose Divider is under Cursor or null if none were found.
